title: The Walking Dead: Final Season will be completed, but not by Telltale Games | Trusted Reviews
description:
![The Walking Dead Final
Season](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**[The Walking Dead – Final
Season](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/walking-dead-final-season-
episode-1) will now be completed by Skybound Games, series’ creator Robert
Kirkham has confirmed at New York Comic Con. **

Production of the game was halted in September when most of the studio’s
employees were laid off. Now, an agreement has been reached with Skybound
Games to complete the project, although specifics remain unconfirmed.

Speaking at the New York City Comic Con, Robert Kirkman, the co-creator of The
Walking Dead, announced that his company Skybound Games had come to a deal to
finish Clem’s story.

[Reported by IGN,](https://uk.ign.com/articles/2018/10/07/telltales-walking-
dead-the-final-season-will-get-its-ending-through-robert-kirkmans-skybound)
Skybound will be working alongside “members of the original Telltale team to
finish the story”, but nothing has been finalised with no mention about
severance owed to the original development team, of which 250 are owed.

> We’re SO happy to announce that we’ve reached a deal with
[@telltalegames](https://twitter.com/telltalegames?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw) that
will allow Skybound to continue
[#TheWalkingDead](https://twitter.com/hashtag/TheWalkingDead?src=hash&ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw):
The Final Season! Let’s wrap up Clem’s story right! More details to come soon.
[pic.twitter.com/ShyREw65iq](https://t.co/ShyREw65iq)

>

> — Skybound Games (@skyboundgames) [October 7,
2018](https://twitter.com/skyboundgames/status/1048735364452634626?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw)

“We’ve successfully negotiated with Telltale Games for our company Skybound to
come in and see Season 4 of the Telltale game to completion,” said Kirkman in
a recent statement.

Back in September Telltale Games [abruptly laid off roughly 250 of its
employees](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/telltale-games-walking-dead-
layoffs-3586109), coming several months after the co-founder and former CEO
Kevin Bruner sued the company.
